p: There is also growing evidence of greenhouse effect-intensifying feedbacks in the Earth system [ 36] that might release enormous quantities of carbon dioxide and methane, independent of fossil fuel combustion, agriculture or deforestation, from sources including warming tundra and increased fires, both of peat and forests [ 37, 38]. Such releases could dwarf the climate saving made possible by the putative implementation of the Paris climate agreement. The strength of the oceanic carbon sink is also weakening [ 39]. If this intensifies it is likely to accelerate warming of the atmosphere, ocean and land.
